post: I'm happy with this: An emulated classic (24-bit 68K) Mac with 5MB of RAM. No original classic Mac had >4MB of RAM as the ROM got in the way (*). I've patched the ROM & System 6 to support a relocated ROM. The main constraint on increasing RAM to e.g. 15MB is now the memory-mapped I/O, which also needs relocation. The eventual goal is a physical large-memory classic Mac.(*) The Mac Portable's ROM location allows up to 9MB of RAM, but it's a bit weird, and I'm going for the full 15+MB.
